meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical reaction in which a substance is oxidized by exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: The leaves were photooxidized by the sun's rays, turning them brown.
meanings.sent2: The old photograph was photooxidized over time, losing its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The cookies were left out in the sun and got photooxidized, making them taste like cardboard.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of fame were slowly photooxidized by the harsh reality of life.
meanings.sent5: The metal gate was photooxidized by the constant sunlight, causing it to rust quickly.

meanings.definition: The process of oxidation caused by exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: The photooxidized of the fruit made it spoil faster than usual.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the photooxidized of different materials under sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The photooxidized of the paint on the walls gave the room a strange smell.
meanings.sent4: The photooxidized of the plastic bottles in the sun created a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The photooxidized of the fabric caused it to lose its color and strength over time.
